DeviantArt Protect: 80,000 NFT Alerts Sent by team on DeviantArt2/9/2022

DeviantArt Protect now scans over 3.8 million new NFT images every week, and since the addition of NFT protection in August 2021, over 80,000 alerts regarding potential NFT infringement have been sent.

DeviantArt Protect: 80,000 NFT Alerts Sent

Jan 4, 20222 min read

Deviation Actions

By
team
Published: Jan 4, 2022
784 Comments
65K Views

DeviantArt Protect now scans over 3.8 million new NFT images every week, and since the addition of NFT protection in August 2021, over 80,000 alerts regarding potential NFT infringement have been sent.


The increase in popularity of non-fungible tokens (NFTs) has been notable in recent months, and with it, the issue of art theft related to NFTs has also grown dramatically. The amount of DeviantArt Protect alerts sent for NFT infringements grew throughout the last three months of 2021, showing increases of:


  • 30% from September to October

  • 100% from October to November

  • Over 300% from November to mid-December


In mid-December, we rolled out an additional layer of protection through DeviantArt Protect—including monitoring and blocking mechanisms—to safeguard and defend deviants against malicious bots that copy art without permission to mint as NFTs.


While the issue of bot-related art theft continues to be a hot topic in the NFT space, DeviantArt is seeing positive results with our technology. Since launching bot protection through DeviantArt Protect, alerts for NFT infringement related to art theft bot attacks dropped over 600%. We will continue to monitor the situation closely, learning from and adapting to new strategies to ensure your art is protected.

DeviantArt Protect was developed in-house by DeviantArt with the purpose of protecting our artists from art theft. Our only collaboration with other creator platforms and NFT marketplaces is leveraging their APIs to scan for possible art infringement.


DeviantArt Protect is available to all deviants for 3 months after each work is submitted, with unlimited coverage on all deviations provided to Core Members.

More DeviantArt Protect News

  • DeviantArt Protect: Helping Safeguard Your Art

  • DeviantArt Protect: Helping Deviants Like You

  • DeviantArt Protect: Helping Artists, More to Come

  • Calling All Creator Platforms to Fight Art Theft

See More by team

Limb-er up your art w/ this tutorial from KaycemDA

26 mins ago
Make sure to follow team to keep up to date with all things DeviantArt! Arm yourself with some appendage academia from @kaycemDA in this awesome weekly tip on arms! Curious about @kaycemDA, find out more in the DeviantArt Collective! Was this helpful for your illustrative arms? Let us know and make sure to share your work with @kaycemDA on their post by clicking the image above!

Announcing the DeviantArt Society

Yesterday
DeviantArt is excited to announce a new program we're embarking upon—the DeviantArt Society—working directly with more artists from around the globe to celebrate art, share knowledge, create events, and ensure that we're building a wonderful home for artists online. These artists join the DeviantArt Collective as part of a larger artist-ambassador program here at DA, the DeviantArt Symposium. The artists in the DeviantArt Society come from a range of styles, mediums, and locations, and all share a passion for the art community that is incredibly contagious. We look forward to sharing more from them in the coming months, and celebrating their art journeys! Meet the DeviantArt Society: @AdorkaStock (Sarah) started modeling for her own references in 2007 when she couldn't find the types of poses she wanted to use for her art. Over a decade later, she's still at it — adding more poses and people to the mix each year! Sarah also works as a full-time artist with her fashion accessory

Tutorial: Draw a Superhero Profile with Bobby Chiu

2 days ago
Draw a Superhero Profile in Under Five Minutes! Superheroes assemble! Learn how to draw the profile of a superhero with a new tutorial from Bobby Chiu (@bobbychiu-official)! For every qualified submission between now and March 21, DeviantArt will donate $1.00 USD to The Superhero Project — up to $5,000 USD! The simple breakdown of steps can be used to create characters of all kinds, but the focus on superheroes is to honor The Superhero Project — a non-profit organization that empowers youth with serious illnesses and special needs. Guided by core values of imagination, inclusion, representation, and joy, The Superhero Project creates a caring global community of children, families and artists. Take part to help raise money for a good cause, and earn a powerful new profile badge in the process! Artwork must be created for the tutorial between March 7 and March 21. Watch the tutorial to discover what shapes help make a superhero profile come to life! To participate, follow

International Women's Day 2022

3 days ago
International Women's Day is a global day celebrating the social, economic, cultural, and political achievements of women. The day also marks a call to action for accelerating gender parity. Marked annually on March 8th, International Women's Day is one of the most important days of the year to: Celebrate women's achievements Raise awareness about women's equality As part of our celebration, on March 8th at 11:00AM Pacific, Extreme Makeup Athlete @mcroft07 hosted a special International Women's Day-themed livestream. Watch below as she transforms herself into Scarlet Witch, one of the most powerful Avengers in the Marvel Universe, while sharing facts about women’s history. Introducing Melissa Croft, aka @mcroft07 Melissa Croft is a self-taught makeup and body artist who streams full time on Twitch. Her favor of strong women from all facets of pop culture, whether they're heroes or villains, stands out in many of her designs. "There are so many strong women in these stories

Join the community to add your comment. Already a deviant? Log In
petrabeas
3 days ago

I think all people in the world know about NFT, and it's not surprising because you can make a lot of money with NFT. I think everyone has heard the story about the man who sold his NFT selfies for several million dollars. NFT is the only way for my friend to make money. He draws original pictures; moreover, he spends money on NFT Promotion. NFT promotion is important because the more people who want to buy your NFT, the more you can sell it. The right marketing strategy will make you rich.
